resources.string: Beware the Blight, stranger. The forests of Edengrove are hazardous enough during normal times.And to be clear, these are not normal times.
Well now, I hope you haven't come to Edengrove to enjoy the seasonal foliage.This is not a season for such pleasures.
If you have no business with me, then move along.
Though the forest is sacred to both the Angry Earth and the Rangers, it is no crime to chop down a tree.
There is no natural system more complex nor more mysterious than the human mind.
I've walked this territory for more years than I can count, but I've never seen the Grove in such chaos. Be careful as you wander this place.
I've heard this place was the seed of all life on Earth, that it was a paradise at some point.
Dangerous as it may be, I think I kinda get that.
You want to know what I think? I think the Angry Earth are just biding their time.
Soon as we defeat the Corruption, they'll come for us. I trust these tree-things any farther than I can throw 'em.
Don't tell the other Wardens, but I think we've been getting a little Blight in our rations. I just hope it doesn't make us all sick.
Sometimes at night, the forest will suddenly get so quiet that it's almost impossible to sleep. I like some kind of background noise, you know.
I joined the Soulwardens to battle Corruption, not dither about in some forest.
Ah, you picked a wonderful time to visit! Nature is at it's most beautiful right now.Please come in and make yourself comfortable.
Welcome to the Dusty Coin. I'm the purveyor of this luxurious establishment.
Our one and only room features four plush cots, some with "vintage" blankets. At least one of them has been laundered. Take your pick.
Fine day out, isn't it? A little humid, but fair weather for Edengrove. How can I help you?
You should have chosen the Marauders, friend. Unless you happen to like being chained down. Some people do.
Hey, pal. I can tell just by looking that you're a person who appreciates life's true joys. That's why you're a Marauder.
Hey, pal. I can tell just by looking that you're a person who appreciates life's true joys. That's why you're a Marauder.\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
Oh, you're not in the Syndicate? I think I'm supposed to shun you. Yeah, I think I remember that from the orientation.
When we pull together, we can do anything! We're the Syndicate!
When we pull together, we can do anything! We're the Syndicate!\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
You know, it's not too late for you. It's never too late to embrace the light of the Spark.
What? Oh, hello. I assume you're here to embrace your sacred duty to the Covenant? Good, good.
What? Oh, hello. I assume you're here to embrace your sacred duty to the Covenant? Good, good.\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
There's a place I know that might interest a glory-seeker like you.
Be mindful of the denizens of this jungle. No doubt you have already experienced their ire.
[The wolf looks at you with a steady, piercing gaze.]
Do you smell that? A sort of… floral wafting. It tickles the mind more than the nose. Oh, if you are looking for the outpost, it is up the road a ways.
You humans, always making such a mess of things. What will it take for you to realize this is not your forest to conquer?
Here I stand, in the cradle of creation, amongst the beings arisen from mother Earth itself. It is awe-inspiring.
If you can, you must listen to one of the High Sage's sermons. The way he sees life… our purpose… it changed me. Perhaps it will change you too.
Do not let the robes deter you. They are quite comfortable.
Others think us strange, but if there is anything I have learned on my journeys, it is to listen first, and judge later.
You have a look about you. A certain… hunger.
Far be it from my place to presume but if it is purpose you desire, I encourage you to speak to the High Sage. He is just inside.
There is something strange going on over there, traveler. My daughter spent mere minutes among them and now will not stop talking about this cult of theirs.
For shame, preying upon a lonely young woman.
I can't put it to words, truly, but there is… something grand here. A universal truth. A great knowing. That sounds ridiculous, but perhaps you felt it too?
Welcome, traveler, to the home of the Cult of Renewal. You will notice we have little to offer, but you may make yourself at home.
Gates of Edengrove
Clear Dryads in the Tarrthail Terrace, and clear Blight Fiends at the Afallach Byre. Then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.
"Where did the Blight come from?"
Yes, that’s the question on everyone’s minds, isn’t it? Edengrove is a place of vast natural magic, the Angry Earth’s ancient home.
If the Blight can spread this fast, even here, maybe nothing can stop it.
Welcome, brave one. Edengrove is a place of great beauty, but it's not for tourists.
It's one of the most deadly territories in Aeternum, especially now with the Blight having taken hold.
"Is it related to Corruption?"
Ah, well, there are many theories, but I prefer facts. Will you help me find some?
I need samples from both the Dryads and the Blight Fiends. That will at least be a start.
The Angry Earth Dryads are deadly enough already, but the Blight makes them even worse.
Ah, thank you, these will do nicely.
It feels odd, trying to help the Angry Earth. My old instructor would have told me off for sympathizing with the enemy instead of taking advantage of their weakness.
"Why do you fight the Angry Earth?"
Survival, brave one. Living humans have always been the most endangered species on Aeternum.
Personally, I’d like to try and find a way to live in harmony with nature. But the Angry Earth are… angry.
Clear the road of Dryads along the Tarrthail Terrace
Defeat {targetName} in the Tarrthail Terrace
Cleanse {POITags} of Blight Fiends
Defeat {targetName} at the {POITags}
Good For What Ails You
Craft or procure a Concentrated Blight Tincture, and then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.
I actually believed we made some diplomatic progress, before the Blight cropped up. It threatens all life in Edengrove, human and Angry Earth alike.
"Shouldn't that bring you closer?"
I thought so too. Some of the dryads seemed amiable, but after the Blight emerged, communication broke down.
If we purge the Blight from the Grove, they might come around… I hope.
"How do we purge it, then?"
I'll study these samples you've recovered. In the meantime, you should learn how to protect yourself against the Blight's effects.
Use this recipe to craft a protective tincture, and then return.
If you do not have the resources to craft a Blight Tincture, you'll have to gather or purchase them from the Trading Post.
Ah, yes. Well done! This can save you from great suffering.
More than a few have limped into the outpost covered in red fungus. They beg for death even as it saps away their strength.
"What happens to them?"
We grant their wish. What else can we do? They die, and don't seem to resurrect.
I fear their true fate may be darker than death, but let's not speak of such things. Just… use the tincture wisely, brave one.
Craft or procure a {itemName}
A Pox On Thee
Defeat Denmen at the top of Tor Fearg tower, and bring his remains to Ellwood in Edengrove.
While you were mixing that tincture, I studied the samples you recovered.
I begin to see a pattern, but I need to study an Angry Earth specimen that's resisted the Blight.
"Where can I find one?"
There is a tower known as Tor Fearg. The tower itself has become Blighted, but some within have resisted.
There's one dryad in particular named the "Denmen." Bring me samples of its vines if you can.
The tower is a rough gauntlet, and the dryads are formidable.
Ah, indeed, a fine specimen. The wood and earth that compose Denmen's vines flow thick with old azoth.
This supports my theory. Did you know Edengrove is the source of all Angry Earth on Aeternum?
"You mean they're born here?"
Yes, it's their home. I theorize that newborn Angry Earth creatures are more susceptible to Blight.
Older creatures like the Denmen are better able to resist, but without more data, a theory is just a theory…
Defeat Denmen atop the tower of {POITags}
Defeat Dryad soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetname} atop the tower for {itemName}
Strength of the Earth
Go to the ruins of Finnabair Allure and investigate the hidden Blight at its heart. Then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.
You've been critical to my efforts thus far, though I know your true aim is to battle Corruption.
I do believe this is all somehow related however, brave one, if you'll humor me.
"Related how?"
I'm not sure yet. There's a fresh outbreak of Blight deep in Elysian Falls, at Finnabair Allure.
The dryads there are old and experienced, and they may be able to resist it… for now.
"You want me to go there?"
Yes, and be wary - even if they are not Blighted, the dryads will consider you a foe.
But a fresh outbreak means fresh Blight samples. The fresher the sample, the more it may reveal about its origins.
We aren't the dryads' true enemy, but they don't make that distinction.
You will undoubtedly have to fight them when you go to collect those Blight samples.
So the dryads at Finnabair Allure have held out so far? That's good. Supports my theory.
Let’s see these fresh Blight samples then… hmmm. Oh. This one is old growth, and yet still infected…
"Does this disprove your theory?"
It certainly contradicts it. If it’s not the age of the Earth specimen that determines its vulnerability to Blight, then what?
I… I must think on this.
I've only just arrived here. I need to get my bearings before I start work. I hope you'll excuse me, for the moment, at least.
Investigate the hidden Blight of {POITags}
Defeat Dryad soldiers at {POITags}
Defeat the Blight Fiends for a sample of Blight
Gum in the Works
Sabotage the Corrupted miners in the Grimman Chasm by raiding their supplies and thinning their numbers. Then report back to Warden Ducquet in Edengrove.
"Why not?"
We've been waiting for the right opportunity, of course. Like your arrival.
This would seem to be the right moment, if you're willing to lead the charge.
Always good to see a fellow Warden walk through those gates.
We've been watching the Corrupted make advances into the forest, but we've yet to stop them.
"I can do that."
Perfect. The Corrupted have been setting mine-camps in the Grimman Chasm.
Strike their positions there, disarm them if you can, and we'll soon know their strength.
Have you been to the Grimman Chasm yet? The fiends think that hiding among the crags will keep them safe.
Success! You're quite the warrior, aren't you? Assaulting their camps and striking without mercy.
Perhaps that will slow their supply chain from Great Cleave and Shattered Mountain, as well.
Sabotage Corrupted miners in the Grimman Chasm
Defeat the {targetName} in the Grimman Chasm
Loot {itemName}s from chests in the Grimman Chasm
Gutting the Guard, Firing the Foreman
Destroy Elite Guard Philippe and Foreman Harold in the mines in the Grimman Chasm. Then report back to Warden Ducquet in Edengrove.
My hope is that we hit these crimson-eyed bastards so hard that THEY have nightmares about US. What do you say we take down their leaders?
"That sounds like a plan to me."
Perfect. The Rangers have identified the commanders.
Elite Guard Philippe and Foreman Robertson - destroy that pair, and we'll have all the Corrupted in Edengrove running scared.
The Rangers say Philippe and Robertson are running operations from within the mine. Good luck, Warden.
Cut off the head and the body will fall! Dealing with those two will bring their operations to a standstill.
That should have the Corrupted questioning their strategy here.
Oh yes, I'm already hearing reports of the Corrupted withdrawing from some sectors.
Way to show them what for, Warden! You've turned things around.
Defeat the Foreman at {POITags}
Defeat the Guardsman at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} in the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} in the {POITags}
Down Reekwater Way
Speak to Aulus Fulvius in Reekwater.
You there! I have need of someone light of foot. I have an urgent message bound for Reekwater to the South.
"I can deliver your message."
You will? Excellent. Although, It is a bit of a trek. But! If you're sure...
This message is for the local Magistrate, Aulus Fulvius. He will have need of your talents beyond the lightness of your feet. Of that, I am certain.
Just head south for… ages, really. Make sure you have plenty of rations for the journey.
Ah… What's this, then? A message all the way from Edengrove? I don't know many who could make that trek in one piece. Consider me impressed.
Since you're here, I believe I can make use of a hardy traveler like yourself.
Fading Lights
Investigate the Ancient Guardians and their movements in the Primal Lochan. Then report back to Ranger Wardell in Edengrove.
I know the Soulwardens are here because of the Corrupted.
But you should also know that here, perhaps more than other places, the Ancient Guardians are a threat as well.
"How are the Guardians a threat?"
Well, in most territories, they are charged with simply securing certain ruins.
Here, however, it seems they are charged with securing all of Edengrove.
"They want us gone?"
Oh, yes. We Rangers have been fighting them back for years.
I fear with all the attention on the Corrupted and the Blight, we've let them regain their strength.
"Is there anything I can do?"
Yes, the Guardians typically launch their attacks from a place called the Primal Lochan.
If your offer is sincere, then attack them there and weaken their forces.
It seems there was a time when the Ancients considered this territory to be exclusively theirs.
The Guardians still seem dead-set on enforcing this mandate.
Ah, there you are. I hope you dealt them a blow from which they won't soon recover.
The last thing we need right now is to fall under attack from the Ancient Guardians.
"They won't attack anytime soon."
Back to their patrol, then. Funny, isn't it? That my duty is the same as theirs.
Will I also someday lose all but bone to my duty? I suppose such philosophical questions are pointless, when the duty remains.
Repel the Ancient Guardian threat at {POITags}
Defeat Ancient Guardians
Azure Tears
Collect Wyrdwood Tears from the dryad soldiers in the Wyrdwood Twists area. Then report back to Ranger Wardell in Edengrove.
Unlike these other Wardens, you've proven that you're not just here to battle the Corrupted. There are many threats to humankind.
Perhaps that means it's safe to share some of the Rangers' secrets with you.
"I'm honored you think I'm worthy."
I do, so listen well. Edengrove is abundant in wyrdwood trees, which have a beautiful glow.
The sap from such trees can be refined into what we call Wyrdwood Tears - sacred to the Rangers.
"What are they used for?"
The Tears benefit one's health, but in truth, we do not refine them ourselves.
Our secret is that we earn them by battling the dryads of the Wyrdwood Twists. Gather some and I will reward you.
Collecting the Tears will support the Rangers out in the wilds.
Ah, these Tears have saved my life more than once when I was alone in the wilds.
These will be much appreciated by the other Rangers, as well. We are, again, in your debt.
"Happy to help the Rangers."
We are whispers in the forest, eyes in shadows... You may not see us, but we will still be watching your back.
I hope you'll come to appreciate our help as we've come to appreciate yours.
Collect Wyrdwood Tears from the Dryads of {POITags}
Defeat Dryad soldiers for {itemName}
Northeast of Eden
Meet Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove's northeast Outpost.
The Survivalist, Ellwood, made mention of your bravery. It seems he's taken such a shine to you that he left a message for you when he left.
"What did he say?"
He was in quite a hurry. His mission to combat the Blight drew him to the northeast Outpost.
He asked if you would meet him there. I told him I would relay the message, and so I have.
The journey northeast will be a difficult one. That I can assure you.
Ah, brave one, I see you have made the journey safely. I am glad to see your face.
Forgive my rush, but I believe that here in the northeast, we will find the answers we seek.
The Rangers will always be at your back, even if you turn and see nothing.
I heard about what you achieved with Madaki, you know. She even sent me some of the designs to decrypt - an impenetrable Tower Shield, in fact.
Diseased Migration
Go to the Blightcrown to investigate the movement of the Blight beyond Edengrove.
"Blight has a purpose?"
I studied the samples you brought me for hours, trying to force them to make sense. I had a revelation!
I believe I finally understand the Blight's origins, and perhaps its ultimate purpose.
Yes, that’s my theory!
Blight is apparently a threat to all life forms, but what if that’s the entire point? What if it's actually a mechanism of self-defense?
"You mean it comes from nature?"
Exactly. We know it's infected Edengrove, but where else has it spread?
Shattered Mountain, I suspect. If you're willing, visit the Blightcrown and Fierna Pass to make sure.
Beyond the Pass is in the Shattered Mountain, where I'm told the Corrupted have amassed in great numbers.
Then you've confirmed it, have you? The Blight extends towards the Shattered Mountain.
The final question remains only; how is the Blight affecting the Corrupted?
"I don’t see any Corrupted."
Aha! Just as I suspected! It’s as much a threat to the Corrupted as it is to rest of us.
The Blight is an attempt by Aeternum itself to fight against the Corruption.
"So it's self-defense?"
Yes, exactly. It must be a last-ditch effort by the land to purge itself of Corruption’s poison.
But this cure will also kill every living thing in Aeternum. We need to remove the poison ourselves before that happens.
I believe our work together has yielded great benefits, brave one.Together, perhaps we can turn the tide against the Blight and this foul Corruption.
The Blight may be as much a blessing as a curse, but it's still a threat, particularly to the Angry Earth. It seems it has even reached the Garden of Genesis.
I have great hope that what we've accomplished by restoring the Garden of Genesis will mean great things in the future.Be well, brave one.
Investigate the presence of Blight at {POITags}
Defeat Angry Earth forces in {POITags}
Threat of Life (Elite)
Watcher Lin has asked you to find a key to enter Zygoramet's Grove and destroy the dangerous creature inside. Then report back to Watcher Lin in Edengrove.
Survivalist Ellwood is telling everyone now that the Angry Earth can help fight the Corruption, and the Rangers actually seem to be falling for it!
No one wants to see the truth - the Angry Earth is FAR more dangerous in the long run.
"Why do you say that?"
There was a naturalist here a few decades ago who disappeared after falling to the Blight.
She had discovered that there is an Angry Earth specimen here capable of replicating itself an infinite number of times... in the blink of an eye!
"In Edengrove?"
Yes. As soon as the Corruption abates, this creature will duplicate itself until it's taken over all of Aeternum.
The creature abides in Zygoramet's Grove to the south. Search the ruins there for a key, then enter the cleft and destroy it. Please... you must believe me.
I am not exaggerating. The creature inside Zygoramet's Grove will consume us all.
Oh, you've returned? The creature is slain then? Damn, you're the first who's actually believed me.
People might not realize it, but we're all a lot safer now.
"Are you sure it won't return?"
Not at all. In fact, I suspect that it will, given everything the naturalist said.
If the vile creature returns, however, we must be prepared to destroy it again. As many times as it takes.
Even with the creature diminished, we must be vigilant with these botanical fiends.
Mark my words - as soon as the Corruption is truly subdued, the Angry Earth will emerge as the greatest threat we've ever known.
Search the ruins of {POITags} for a key to enter Zygoramet's Grove
Defeat {targetName} to collect an {itemName}
Enter Zygoramet's Grove
Defeat {targetName}
Slag the Mines
Wreak havoc on the Slag Mines operations by burning key operational equipment and recover a set of survey notes for Foreman Gowering.
"It must feel awful, starting from nothing."
Start over? To hell with THAT idea. No. In theory I can make more coin. What I can't replace is my dignity.
I'll play it straight with you. If I can't have this mine and all its riches, no one can.
"So… revenge, then?"
Oh, aye. Absolutely. First, I need you to recover the results of a survey I did. Not something I want in the hands of the Corrupted.
For the rest? Here's a torch. Burn. It. Down.
I want to see smoke on the horizon. I want to hear them screaming.
I see the smoke on the horizon. Warms a soul, it does.
It doesn't balance my ledger, but at this point I don't think anything will. I'm a well and truly ruined man. Maybe I'll take up lumberjacking.
"What about the survey?"
This? I'm inclined to tear it up. Or keep it for a souvenir. Either way, it's useless.
Here's my last coin, more a keepsake at this point… not even enough to buy bread.
Storm into {POITags} and disrupt their operations
Recover the {itemName}
Disrupt the Slag Mines Operations
Burn the forge
Destroy supply lines
Burn Tents
Burn the Sawmill
Burying the Lead
Find the entrance of the underground chamber in the Upper Slag Mines. Bury it in rubble so the Corrupted cannot access the contents of the chamber.
"'It' being the contents of the survey?"
Just so. If my equipment worked and my surveyor is to be trusted, it was the entrance to a massive underground chamber. Ideally full of treasure.
The Corrupted CANNOT have it. Is that clear?
I'm proper pleased that we have this understanding. Let me know when you've rescinded their invitation to invade my cavern.
Oh, I heard. A fine collapse! Did you take the rest of the mine with it? Probably not, but a man can dream of a sweeter revenge.
I already gave you my last coin, but here. A little keepsake of your own.
Enter {POITags} and bury Foreman Gowering's discovery
Strike the scaffolding to weaken the structure
Strike the final blow to bury the ancient door
Parted in Anger
Speak to members of the Cult of Renewal to learn what happened to Han Fang's daughter, Han Liu.
I knew I should have kept a closer eye on her… Oh! Apologies, I did not hear you approach.
If you have come to inquire about fine silks, I am afraid I am unable to take new requests at this time.
"Is someone missing?"
How embarrassing. Yes. This is all so personal, and you a total stranger, but my daughter Han Liu has vanished.
She was invited to share a meal with some strangers in white robes and simply did not come home.
"White robes? What are they, a cult?"
I do not know what they are, but when I asked about her, they turned me away. They seem to think I will "interfere with her journey."
Maybe they will speak to you. I just want to know that she's safe.
I know I ask a great deal of you, stranger. You have my family's gratitude. Please bring my daughter back to me.
You return! Did they speak to you? I cannot fathom they would turn you away as well. You do not have that "hovering mother" look about you.
"I think you were right to be worried."
When I was young, I thought the notion of mother's intuition was pure superstition. But I was right… and it is a truly terrible feeling.
I did not act, and now she is gone. Can she be saved?
You made it back! Quickly- is my daughter with you? Is she well?
Your presence is… something. This is not a favor I would have ever dreamed of asking, but you have exceeded every hope and expectation I have had. For that, I am in your debt.
For now… we watch. We wait.
Seek out the Cult of Renewal
Talk to Cultist Akech
Talk to Cultist Ylva
Talk to Cultist Jalair
Talk to High Seer Agnes
Hello, stranger! Have you come to learn from the High Sage as well?
Yours is not a face I have seen before, but I will let you in on a little secret.
I hear the High Sage is due to make an appearance today. You will not want to miss it!
I know that look. A little overwhelmed, a little uncertain. There is no need. You will find only kindness here. How can I put you at ease?
Ah, a fellow seeker. Welcome to the home of the Cult of Renewal. The High Sage will be among us shortly. In the meantime, how may this High Seer be of service?
Share what you learned with Han Fang
The Cult of Renewal
Find Han Liu by joining her on the Cult of Renewal's so-called "Path of Truth."
When you say I should be worried… the mind can conjure up any number of things. I need you to be specific and honest with me. Where is my daughter?
"They mentioned a trial."
They would. How like a cult to both prevent me from speaking to her after she was in their clutches and then immediately send her away to prove herself.
And how very like Liu to leap to impress…
"They said she might not return at all."
Why would they… she could die? She cannot even wield a sword.
Stranger, I do not know how to ask this of you, but you must save her. I do not care how. Lie to them. Follow her. Bring her back to me.
I only hope we are not too late.
I cannot tell you what a relief it is to see another on the road. I was truly beginning to worry I would need to continue on alone!
Talk to High Seer Agnes
Enter {POITags} in search of a sacred pool
Defeat {targetName} to protect Han Liu on her journey
Anoint the Seeds in the sacred pool
Find Han Liu on the road
Walking Wyrds
Complete your own Path of Truth by planting an imbued seed at each of the Angry Earth shrines within the Wyrdwood Twists. Help Han Liu do the same by clearing the path of Angry Earth.
I did not expect to see anyone else on the road. I admit, it gives me comfort. These creatures make me nervous.
Wait… those seeds in your hand. Are you also walking the Path of Truth?
It is such a comfort to have another traveler beside me. This is my first adventure on my own, truth be told.
"At your mother's request, yes."
My mother? She truly cannot mind her own affairs, can she? This is MY choice. Those people were kind to me. All I want to do is learn more about them!
"I want to learn more about them, too."
I'm not sure I believe you, but would you help clear the road ahead? These creatures frighten me, I feel as if I have come as far as I can on my own.
I can climb well enough, but I am afraid I am rather useless in a fight. I hope for both our sakes that you are equipped to handle this.
Forgive me for being so cryptic before. This trial is certainly not for the faint of heart, but it does help us find those who truly think and feel as we do.
I'm eager to hear about your journey.
Follow the Path of Truth into the Wyrdwood Twists
Look at my arm. See how the hair stands on end? I am RADIATING energy! Are you bound for Umbrage as well? Are we to travel together once more?!
My heart and mind are full to bursting and there's still so much left to learn! So much of it is… intangible. I feel I am connected to something greater than myself, but what is it?
There is so much we do not know about this place, its denizens, and our role among them.
The High Sage tells me he has some lessons planned for us. I cannot wait!
I see you have chosen to return to us. I speak for all of when I say how glad we are. Now, how can this High Seer help you?
How fare your studies? Have you gained a better understanding of our ways?
The High Sage is a very busy man. I would not dream of discouraging you from speaking to him; he is the source, after all.
But do bear in mind that I am also equipped to answer any questions you may have.
Another newcomer! Between you and ah... Miss Liu, was it? I do not feel quite so out of sorts.
I am eager to learn what comes next. This place is so very mysterious!
The glossy, thick pages are well preserved. The thick tome rests open on a page with an embossed title: "The Oath of Renewal"
The glossy, thick pages are well preserved. The thick tome rests open on a page with an embossed title: "The Oath of Renewal"
Defeat {targetName} to protect Han Liu on her journey
Plant Seeds at Angry Earth Shrines
Plant a seed at Twisted Roots
Plant a seed at Sapterlith
Plant a seed at Beinn Creagg
Return to the enclave of the Cult of Renewal
Spoken Wyrds
Talk to Han Fang about taking the oath to officially join the Cult of Renewal.
I see Miss Liu has found her way back to us. I do not suppose you had anything to do with that?
Do not worry. A shared trial is quite in the spirit of our ways. Now, however, we stand at another crossroads.
"Have I not proven myself?"
You have, but in deed only. I have seen your commitment to understanding what it is we are doing here and it has been noted.
But here, we believe words hold power as well. Miss Liu has already spoken hers.
"Is there some sort of ceremony, then?"
Ah! Nothing so formal as that. This is but the first step you will take with us.
There is a tome before the High Sage that contains the binding words that unite us. Speak them to him, and we will call you ours.
The High Seer told me you were hovering about. Do not be shy. We are all equals here.
While the High Seer will almost assuredly push you toward this trial or that, I want to remind you that you may undertake this journey at your own pace.
Why rush? Enlightenment cannot be forced.
You delivered the oath well, strong and true, but I see in your eyes that some uncertainty about us and our cause lingers.
That is normal, at this stage. I hope in time you will grow to feel welcome here.
Judging by your demeanor, you do not have bad news for me. I will take that small comfort. Continue doing what it is you are doing. Where my daughter goes, walk with her in my stead.
We did it! I was terrified the whole time. I searched for dryads around every corner, but mysteriously there were none.
I am not one to spit a blessing in the face. We are here now and our future is bright!
While you were fetching herbs, I was given the privilege of washing the rite-goers feet! It was terribly formal and grave. Significant.
It gives me chills, and I hope to stand where they do some day.
I regret that you could not see Miss Liu off. I hope she returns to a familiar face like yours. There is no greater pleasure after a long journey.
Until you have planted the seeds, I am afraid we cannot continue to discuss your inclusion into our enclave.
You can help me prepare a small celebration for their return.
You are advancing with auspicious speed, my friend. Is it hunger for more, or are you driven by the idea of earning your place here?
If it is the latter, I encourage you to relax. You are one of us.
The High Sage spoke those words to me when first we met. I felt them so stark, so prescient, that I saved them for all to come.
Welcome to the Cult of Renewal, my friend. I now name you Initiate, and soon all of our knowledge will be yours.
Relay this information to Han Fang
Stand before The High Sage
Take the Oath
A Sword in my Stead
Try to talk Han Liu out of undergoing a difficult rite and help her succeed if she insists on going anyway.
Liu came to me just now, positively bursting with news. I cannot even tell if the cult allowed her to speak to me, but I think I may have only made matters worse.
I do not know what to do.
"What went wrong?"
She mentioned yet another trial, this time to one of those dryad-infested towers! I need not remind you how utterly defenseless she is!
I pushed too hard to keep her here, to stop her. She told me to stay away.
"I can try and talk her out of it."
Would you? If you think it will work… I think we both know how this will end.
If you can safeguard her as you did before, it will add to this considerable debt I owe you. Please go where I cannot, my friend.
What on Aeternum is this cult after? It feels to me as if they are trying to get their followers killed. Oh Liu… why won't you listen?
What a triumph. In so little time both you and Miss Liu have not only demonstrated a willingness to learn, but also a deep, abiding respect for the denizens of Edengrove.
For this, we place our full trust in you.
Just look at him. He is transformed. I wish this for all of us, including you.
Try not to tell the others what you told me, about the gold. They may think you are not dedicated to the cause.
You made it! Look at us! Did the High Seer say the trust thing to you as well?
I will not lie to you. I was not certain if you or Miss Liu could complete the Path of Truth. It turns a great many away, but those who return? Well.
You are one of us now. Be welcome.
Each trial marks our achievement among the cult, this one second only to the rite my fellows and I are about to endure. I consider it a privilege to stand here, don't you?
I am ready, come what may. The tea may help, but I do not need it. No, my heart is already open. Let there be more for the others.
Try to dissuade Han Liu
Ascend the tower {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Dryads to clear the way for Han Liu
Prove your worth by reaching and touching the Umbral Orb
Speak to High Seer Agnes at [PH]Cult Camp
One of Us
Venture to Buggane Hedge and harvest herbs for a calming tea from the hides of dryads.
These three to my left stand on the precipice of the final rite.
They are soon to depart, once they have taken their tea and had a moment to meditate. I feel strongly that this group will succeed.
"What happens after?"
Like myself and the High Sage, and the scores of Exalted, they will have gained the deepest, most complete understanding of our way of life.
They will then go forth into Aeternum and tell others what they found.
"I take it Han Liu and I are not ready."
No, but I think bearing witness will prepare you. For your part, there are some ruins to the north where dryads grow a specific herb on their bodies.
Collect some for our rite-goers. That will help see them off.
I find a calming tea helps center them, opens their mind to the experience they are about to have.
This is a fine bundle of herbs. I hope you did not have a great deal of trouble acquiring them- it is a tricky task at best.
And I have never met a dryad that gave them willingly. I will brew the tea, now.
Seek calming herbs from the denizens of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Something to Celebrate
Venture into the verdant forests of Edengrove to harvest colorful flowers in celebration of the returning cultists.
As you have likely noticed, only one of our rite-goers has returned. This does happen, and more often than not.
Do not mourn them. Their convictions carried them to the end. Their sacrifice is not in vain.
"What happens if they do not return?"
Ah… I would prefer not to darken the mood with that discussion. I will, but not now. In this moment I would like to assume they will succeed.
Can you procure some bright flowers, so we can make wreathes for them?
I find a nice flower wreathe to heighten any bright and cheerful moment. And their return shall be so!
You have a fine eye for color. Yes, these will do nicely. I will save the extras for another time, perhaps dry them. That seems appropriate.
Enter {POITags} and harvest colorful blooms
I'm told there will be tea. It is all so grave and ceremonial. I am trying not to smile too much. Very serious.
I remember my own Umbrage trial. Would you believe it if I said I perished during it?
Only on my third attempt did I reach the summit and depart unscathed. Consider me impressed.
Now that I stand here, peering into those dark trees, I feel a terrible sense of dread. This fear is a mere distraction. Surely the tea will help, as intended.
I heard that you and Miss Liu took the oath! I am very pleased. One of the greatest pleasures in life is sharing what one has learned with others.
If you have questions, please do not hesitate to ask.
While I mourn each soul that we lose, I cannot help but feel my heart swell with pride at every individual that returns to us.
I would hate to see you excluded after all we have accomplished together. Have faith, my friend!
Perhaps the other two are merely delayed…? At least one returned.
Judging by his demeanor, it must have been a deeply meaningful experience. Oh, I cannot wait for my own!
I cannot put into words what I saw, what I felt. I see, now. I understand our purpose.
Rest, contemplation, and meditation is in order for all of us. Our most recent Exalted will need time to recover from their ordeal, after all.
Miss Liu brought us not only herself, but three new members of our order. An auspicious start.
And you. Your contributions are to be noted. Your future is bright indeed.
Harvest {itemName}
Waste Not, Want Not
Retrieve the fallen belongings of cultists who have failed their final rite.
As grave as this task was, I hope you found the significance of what we are trying to accomplish.
Only the most devoted ever seek to undertake this rite, and so they would not want us to waste their efforts.
"Is that it? They just… don't come back?"
Enjoy the grounds. Celebrate. Rest. You will be called upon when you are ready for the next step.
Not as themselves, no. They likely still linger in the forest in a more… lacking state. A soulless state, one could say.
If you want to see for yourself, there is more you can do.
"What can I do for them, now?"
Not for them. For us. Our cult grows every day. We must feed, clothe, and shelter all who come to us.
Those who left us would want us to use their belongings for good. You can recover what they no longer need.
Everything we do is to strengthen the cult. No one individual rises above that goal. Not even myself. Not even the High Sage.
You went into the forest? Oh, this curiosity of mine is consuming! Tell me, tell me, what did you see? What happened to them?
"They are Lost, and we are stealing their gold."
Lost? Mindless… things?! How tragic! And what do you mean by 'stealing'? Do we not share all that we have?
I can see how you might THINK that, but maybe you need to spend more time studying their ways.
Recover cultists' belongings from {POITags}
Gather {itemName}
Subdue {targetName} for {itemName}
Deliver the recovered items to High Seer Agnes
Where You Go, I Will Follow
Help Han Fang reunite with Han Liu.
I came as soon as I heard about this 'final rite' of theirs. I had to see myself, and I feared Han Liu may try it.
I am immeasurably grateful that she did not, but…
"I do not think she will leave them."
I think you are right. I have a terrible choice to make. I can continue to beg her to leave.
She will push me away, perhaps forever. Or… I can let her be, and risk her enduring the same fate as the others.
"Or you could join them, like I did."
Join them? But the things they expect, the risks… But I could be near her. I can care for her. I can hold her hand, even to an unspeakable end.
… And, perhaps, I can ease her away, but slowly. Over time.
"You should tell her."
I do not want to approach her now. She may think I am snooping again. Here. Give her this trinket. She will know what it means. It belonged to her father.
I hope she will hear me out, this time.
Why is my mother here? What did she say? I hope she does not mean to lecture me AGAIN.
"She wanted you to have this."
This belonged to my father. The inscription means "Where you go, I will follow." To give it to me now...
I suppose it is time for my mother and I to have a long, honest talk. Thank you… for everything.
As complex as our relationship may be, I am glad my mother is here. She and I have been through so much together.
Eternity would be rather lonely without her. Thank you for this gift.
At least she is speaking to me again. It is a small consolation, but perhaps in time I will get through to her.
And if not… I will see this cult dismantled, even if I have to do it myself.
With each sacrifice, we gain more in trust, purpose, and understanding.
It is a long road to comprehending all that we hope to be, but I am glad that you have chosen to join us on this journey of ours.
Dangling Out of Reach
Travel to Basalrot Bridge and collect mushrooms for Lilian.
"Mycophile?"
Ah, yes. Mushrooms. I love them. Finding them, classifying them, and of course tasting them. In stews, porridge, sautéed , and yes, raw.
Ah, my manners. You are quite busy, so! My request.
"Let me guess… mushrooms."
Haha, clairvoyance! I am no stranger to foraging in these harsh conditions, but the variety that I wish to sample are located out of my reach, atop a great crumbling bridge.
Not a challenge for you, perhaps?
My mouth waters in anticipation. No matter how many I try, each is a delight unlike any other. I have come to crave it so!
What an interesting specimen you have found. I hope you used gloves. This ooze is suspect, no?
Ah well, I will boil these. That will rid them of this foulness. Ah, I cannot WAIT to taste.
"Is that a good idea? It's probably Blighted."
Your concern is noted, my friend. However! This is Aeternum!
Even if these mushrooms are of a deadly variety, my soul will find my body again and I can continue as ever. So, no mushroom shall go untasted.
Forage for mushrooms from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} along the edges of the bridge
Symbiotic Delicacies
Venture to Mag Mell's Fancy to forage for mushrooms from the hides of Angry Earth dryads.
"That depends. What sort of mushrooms?"
I happened to be walking along the path to the west and noticed some rather unfriendly plant beings. As I was sprinting away, I noted they had mushrooms growing on their backs! I am terribly curious!
"About how they taste?"
Yes, but also no. Fungi are decomposers. But things do not die in the usual way here! How does a living being have mushrooms growing in their flesh?
Bring me some, and I will learn the answer. Then, I will eat!
My, how my stomach does roil. Is it hunger or toxic mushrooms? One of life's many mysteries.
A pile of haphazard journals and loose pages rests atop an empty foraging basket.
Forage for mushrooms from {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
A Quick Jaunt Into Death
Get a drink while you wait for Lilian to return.
[Drop off the mushrooms and read the note.]
My friend, those mushrooms were indeed poisonous. I am soon to die. In the meantime, I have an open tab at the inn.\nEnjoy a drink, relax, and I shall be with you momentarily. - Lilian
A pile of haphazard journals and loose pages rests atop an empty foraging basket.
Did you enjoy your drink? I hope I did not worry you overly much.
Mushrooms and death, they do go hand in hand. It is beautiful, in a way.
Speak to the Innkeeper
Return to Lilian d'Ogremont
Mysteries of the Mycelium
Venture to Angry Earth shrines to collect samples of the white, stringy fungus Lilian described.
"Because you came back to life?"
Well, yes, that is always a pleasant surprise. But, no.
I saw in this death-dream a great maze of white beneath this place. Under our very feet! It touches everything, connecting all that is.
"A maze of white what exactly?"
Fungus! Of course. Look at me. Mycophile. Silly thing.
Mycelium, I believe it is called. Dig a little in any old forest, and there you will find it. White. Stringy. Connected. Fetch me some, yes? You will see.
By your own hands, you will understand what my mind conjured for me. One of the great mysteries of this beautiful, fungal world.
Now do you understand?
It is like… little rivers of fungus, drawn together like a great fishing net, touching everything in this great old jungle. Connecting it!
"I even found some inside a bear."
Oh? What is this? It makes little sense to me. But these dryads, these creatures, they are not like us. Not flesh.
What a mystery. A mycelius mystery. Something to ponder on. Thank you for this gift!
Forage for fungus within {POITags}
Dig for {itemName}
Forage for fungus within {POITags}
Dig for {itemName}
[NYI] Collect {itemName} from Dryad Bear
Medicinal Qualities
Collect medicinal herbs from Lough Du Lac swamp to help Sai Khanam recover from her wounds.
"It looks like you were attacked."
Not unscathed, I'm afraid. They came while we were resting and upended everything. It seemed as though they were searching for something.
I am far from the outpost and these wounds are… worrying.
Ho there! I could use a helping hand. I have run into some trouble on the wild road.
"Those cuts do look deep."
Oh… they are. If it were not for my companion, that would have been the end of me. I happen to know a little herb-lore, and I smell a swamp nearby.
Can you collect some herbs for me? I will draw you a picture.
I am in no immediate danger, but I am in considerable pain. Any help you can offer is appreciated.
You found them! What fine specimens. The soil here must be very fertile.
I will make a poultice. It will prevent infection and deal with some of this pain. I am in your debt.
Enter the swamp Lough Du Lac in search of herbs
Gather {itemName}
Thieves in the Night
Before you go. When the Angry Earth attacked, they took most of my things.
My cooking supplies, my map, my food. Everything except the tent and my bow really.
Find and retrieve Sai Khanam's stolen belongings.
"Were they looking for something?"
It seems that way, doesn't it? I cannot fathom what I could have in my possession that would interest a dryad.
Regardless, I cannot continue my journey without my things. Can you recover them for me?
It was very dark when they came, but I believe they ran to the west of here, up the slope behind me. Thank you again for your aid.
Ah! You found them! And mostly intact, too. Did the wolf come with you?
Where is he? He has never strayed from me before…
Follow the trail to collect Sai's stolen belongings
Seek the rest of Sai's things from {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Here, Boy!
Help Sai Khanam track down her wolf companion.
Did you happen to see my wolf companion on your way back? He was behaving so strangely, it is like nothing I have seen before.
"Strangely how?"
After you left, he turned to me and simply plucked my bow out of my hands with his teeth!
It caught me off guard, and by the time I thought to chase him, he was gone. Could you find him for me?
We have not traveled together long, but already I cannot imagine going on without him. I hope this is not the end of our companionship.
Hello, human. I am afraid I cannot return my companion's bow to you.
"Wait. You can talk?"
Obviously. I am called Scout. I commend your tracking skills, and without a nose like mine. Well done.
Follow the trail the "Dog" left in the mud
Enter {POITags} in search of Sai's companion
Defeat {targetName}
Find the "Dog"
Scout's Big Secret
Return to Sai Khanam and give her the totem Scout gave you.
As I said, I cannot return the bow to you. Though Sai cannot know this, it is a grave affront to touch a dryad's bow, let alone wield it. They are grown from their bodies, and act as another limb.
"I did not come for the bow."
You are not? Ah… Sai must be worried about me. What a strange thing, to be bound to one of your kind. Our aims are so often opposed.
"Will you return to her?"
…Yes, I will return to her. We have weathered many storms together.
But she will need more protection than I can offer. Deliver her this charm… and say nothing of my voice. Please.
Please do not share the fact that I can speak with her. I will tell her, in my own time and my own way.
He came back! And-- what is this carving? Did you make this? I will cherish this, as I cherish him. I suppose I should finally choose a name for him, eh?
"How about… Scout?"
Scout… that DOES ring true, doesn't it? You are very good. Scout it is.
I cannot thank you enough for reuniting us, stranger. You have a place at my fire, should you ever need one.
You are welcome to my fire and the contents of my cookpot. You need only ask.
I am sure Scout feels the same way. He really enjoys his name. Wags his tail whenever I say it!
[The wolf wags his tail once in acknowledgement of your greeting.]
[Scout sits patiently and stares at you with an unmistakably expectant look in his eye.]
[Scout winks at you.]
Deliver the totem to Sai Khanam
The Work You Undid
Replant the medicinal herbs you stole to their proper place within Lough Du Lac.
Well, if it isn't the petty thief. Come to help yourself to more of my garden?
"Your garden? You mean this swamp?"
I suppose it would look like a swamp to one such as yourself. Damp, smells of mold, and rampant with life. Offensive to human noses, no doubt.
No matter. I would have you restore the herbs that you stole.
We have little to say to one another until you have completed the task at hand.
I will say this about your kind; You are remarkably efficient.
I know your customs. You expect a reward of coin in exchange for the work of your hands. Consider it done.
Enter the swamp {POITags} to replace the stolen herbs
Replant the stolen herbs
Waiting on the Wind
Now that the wind is right, climb to the top of the bridge Avernal Verdure and burst the plant bulbs to release their pollen.
If you are in the habit of accepting errands in exchange for coin, I have another task for you.
"I'm interested."
I keep an aerial garden above the canopy, just east of here. You can find it atop a crumbling bridge.
The wind is right to burst the bulbs I have cultivated. The smallest pressure will do.
You can use your feet to burst them, if it pleases you.
I can see from the pollen on your boots that the deed is done. Soon all of Edengrove will become my garden. Here is your payment, human.
I no longer require your services. Our relationship has thus concluded and you may go. Do not forget that these are our trees, and this is our jungle.
What did you expect would happen, inviting flame into the green places cultivated by the Angry Earth?
Our time together has been brief, but even I am shocked by this foolishness.
Seek out the plant bulbs atop the bridge {POITags}
Pop blossoms to release their pollen
Even Greater Heights
Help Hedera expand her garden by climbing the ruins and planting a flower seed at its highest point.
If you intend to linger here, I have one more task for you. How adept are you at climbing? I find your kind possess this skill to a greater degree than mine.
"What am I climbing?"
To the point. Efficient, as I said. There are ruins atop the rise to the north. It is one of the highest points in Edengrove.
Ascend the stone and nestle this seedling amongst the cracks at its pinnacle.
Try not to fall. Your bones are fragile, I have heard.
In time, the bloom will mature and the wind will carry its scent far and wide. It is a species I have cultivated from my own body. A point of pride for my kind.
I am finished with your services. Take your reward.
I am not adept at reading human emotion, but it appears you have encountered something concerning in your travels. Curiosity demands that I ask.
Do not mistake my earlier willingness to exchange coin for services as a gesture of good faith. This is not your home.
Return to wherever it is you have come from.
Ascend to the ruins to plant a seed at its highest point
Plant a flower at the highest point
Hold Your Breath
Destroy the strange flowers clinging to the rocks, ideally without breathing in their scent.
You there! Cover your nose immediately!
[Cover your nose.]
Let me… gather my thoughts. Just hold on. I had it. It was right there.
Yes! Flowers. Big ones. Red. Do NOT breathe their scent.
"You seem disoriented."
Am I? I am! The moment I smelled that flower…
Just get rid of them. Rip them up by their roots. Do it without breathing. No one else can suffer as I do.
Do. Not. Smell. The. Flowers.
How strange. They are gone, but the scent remains. Do you smell it? Are you afflicted too?!
"I don't smell anything."
Gods, how long is this going to last? You should go. I feel compelled to stay and if I am being honest, I do not think I could walk if I wanted to.
Enter Buggane Hedge to destroy the strange blooms
Destroy the strange blooms
A Dark Compulsion
Clear the path to the north and west to allow Ranger Yasin to pass unharmed to… wherever it is he is going.
Wait. WAIT. Do not go. I need your help. This is going to sound like insanity.
I cannot go back to the outpost, but I need --Look at me-- NEED to find her. Please help. I beg of you.
"I'm sorry, find who?"
I know how it sounds. I hear myself. My feet will move me down this path either way. I can FEEL her, waiting. How do I know this? Sahal! Wake yourself!
"You're not dreaming."
I would have more control of myself in a dream! I am going down that path.
My sword arm will not lift. I can SEE it. It is already written. If you care for a ranger's life, please clear the way for me.
It is taking every ounce of will I have to stay here. Please, clear the way.
Where is she? I am here! I saw it in my mind! Ranger, shake yourself out of it.
Just… hold a moment. Let me think. Let me breathe.
Defeat {targetName} to clear the path
Meet Ranger Yasin near the stone bridge
Crying Out for Love
Ascend the rise and light a bonfire to help signal Ranger Yasin's presence to his "love."
Ascend the rise and light a bonfire to help signal Ranger Yasin's presence to his "love."
She must not know I am here. Yes… why else would my love fail to appear? I must find a way to signal her!
"Hold on. Your LOVE?"
I am speaking to you with all the sincerity in my heart. If I do not find her, I will die. I know it, like I know my own name. My heart will shatter in my chest.
"Well, when you put it that way."
A pyre! A grand conflagration! A beacon that will shine over all of Edengrove!
Go and raise a fire atop the nearest rise. My love will see it, and she will come. It is written.
She will see it, and she will come. She will see it, and she will come! She must…
Move aside! Surely she must--
"I was attacked. This is a trap."
The blaze was so bright! Surely it shone for miles! How could she forsake me now? No. It is I who have failed her. Please go, now.
I am unworthy of her love. I will die here. I know it like I know my own bones. Please leave me to die.

Out of His Misery
Speak to the dryad Hedera to find a way to rid Ranger Yasin of his affliction.
Speak to the dryad Hedera to find a way to rid Ranger Yasin of his affliction.
This misery is all consuming. I feel my spirit slipping away, moment by moment. Yet… I do not want to die.
"I don't think you do either."
My feet are bound to this spot as a tree is rooted to the earth. I can do nothing to change my fate… but you can.
Find her. Find my love, and beg her to end this torment. Please.
I feel wretched. Like my heart is being rent from my chest. Please, hurry.
Ah. You lived. Thank you for dealing with that nuisance. I believe I owe you coin, as per your custom.
"Your flowers killed him."
You helped. Efficiently, at that. Allow me to illuminate something for you, in addition to your payment. Your kind are not welcome here. Begone.

You're the one who's worked with Madaki, aren't you?
Yes, I've heard all about you. I also managed to discover a design for a legendary bow, if you're interested.
"Everyone needs a good bow."
Yes, well, if you have sharp eyes, and indeed, you must, if you spotted me here.
This bow is the mighty Torrent, a bow of legend among the rangers. Acquire these items and it shall be yours.
The Torrent would be the envy of any archer in Aeternum. A weapon without equal, I think.
You've got it all, eh? Otherworldly sinew, ancient bone, an oil coat, and a perfect string for a perfected draw.
Take this bow, the Torrent, and wield it with pride. It's in a class all of its own.

As much as I have a deep appreciation for nature, I believe human ingenuity is a miracle in its own right.
Think of all we've accomplished across history. It's magnificent.
"I heard you know muskets."
There's no better feeling than a musket in your hands, the power of fire, steel, and science.
There might even be an opportunity to craft a wholly unique firearm, if you're interested.
"I'm definitely interested."
I've been calling this design the "Clamorous Vox", for how loud its gunfire will be.
Bring Ranger Madaki the parts and we'll be able to make you a musket beyond compare.
Madaki has the designs. You need only supply the parts.
You've acquired the parts for the Clamorous Vox.
Very well, then you shall have it. A finer musket the world has never known. Wield it well.

Recover the components needed to create the Great Axe called Reformation, then deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
The Reformation
Ah, you are the one who decrypted the Corrrupted's weapon recipes with Ranger Madaki.
I was actually able to translate the formulation for a massive Great Axe.
"You know how to forge it?"
I do. The Corrupted call this design 'the Reformation', and though I despise them, I like the name.
Gather the components on this list and bring them to Madaki. Then the Reformation will be yours to wield.
Have you ever noticed how the Corrupted smell?
It's like some kind of sulfuric body odor mixed with spoiled fruit. Dreadful.
Here we are, you've acquired the components for the Great Axe.
Well done, this is an axe destined to fell many Corrupted. Wield it with savage fury, {playerName}. Give them something to fear.

Gather components to create the legendary tower shield Rook's Defense.
The classical opening and setting of the board from the Indian game Chatur that would later inspire Chess. Your opening lies in Malevolence.
In this deadly game of Chess, the ivory pieces move first. Your first move is to Scorpius.
The ability of the Pawn to dash forward to the front lines in its first play is a formidable move. Your next move takes you to Eridanus.
The Persian story of Shahnameh, the reenacting of an epic battle on a Chess board. Your battle continues in Periville.
Once a piece has been touched on the Chess board it must be moved. Your next move takes you to Stone Skull Fort.
Should a Pawn make it to the other side of the board alive it will be crowned a Queen. Your crowning comes in Infernal Host.
Castling is a move in Chess wherein the King moves two squares towards a Rook, and then the Rook moves to protect their King’s flank. Castle yourself in Mangled Heights.
An announcement that the other player's King has been placed in a position of peril. Check the Corrupted of Opulence.
"You know how to forge it?"
I do. Using a shield, and one like this in particular, requires a strategy all of its own.
It's like a game I once played called 'Chess'; this shield is like the Rook to defend your King.
"How do we create it?"
Find these components and bring them to Madaki. She is the master of the Forge, of course.
With these elements, she'll be able to grant you the 'Rook's Defense'.
There is no shield I have ever seen as formidable as the Rook's Defense will be.
A masterful game you've played, acquiring these components.
You've earned Rook's Defense, and will doubtlessly wield it with the same impressive valor. Checkmate, indeed.

Go to {POITags}
Go to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Can I read you my latest poem? It's only 200 lines. Andeolus says my skills are improving. But Joan says she'd rather lose her right arm than hear another line.
"Umm…sure, read it."
To stay in Aeternum is to live as an eternal. To accept sorrow is to live as an infernal.
To wake up in the morning is to live as a diurnal. To come back home is to live as a returnal.
You look learned. I humor Milosh but he has to work on himself and ahem…his poetry, a bit more.
Luckily for him, I've read Meditations and learnt how to accept the shortcomings of those who aren't as gifted as I am.
Can I trust you or will you disappear as soon as you get what you want from me? Like my family did.
Milosh wants me to hear his poetry. Andeolus wants me to make him look smart. I'm just looking for people who won't leave me.
If you see an Auberon Gowering, tell him Tello is onto him and won't rest till he avenges his friends.
He sold the mine to the Corrupted to line his pockets. And now he cries over what happened? He's a damned fool!
Do you know how to escape the island safely? I've heard stories of storms at sea and cursed ships, how no one survives.
I can't stay here without my wife. Everything reminds me of her. How do I heal when I can't let her go?
If everything is an illusion, why do we make an effort to hide the truth?
I used to make wigs to cover up baldness once. Mousy brown. Now? I help people express who they truly are; every color of the rainbow.
Who needs a husband when you have wealth of your own? A few gems to buy a house, a few more to hire a pair of handsome guards. Life is good.
Hellooo! Are you paying attention? I am looking for an adventurer to write songs about, one that doesn't hunt dryads, like my last one did.
Dryads are such exquisite creatures. To hurt one is nothing short of uncultured.
Isn't Yadira divine? Her smile is like the sun bordering the horizon. Fleeting, but it fills my soul with joy.
To see her is to experience God. To kiss her is to be reborn.
Yadira is a practical woman. And my brother is a dreamer. The two would never work out.
What she needs is a strong man. A man of the earth. Like me. If only my brother would admit it and get out of our way.
Have you seen Auberon? He's a good man. Was a good father.
We lost our sons to the Angry Earth. He blames himself for not being able to buy them the armor they needed.
Stay wary of Auberon. He is a conniving snake who has fooled my sister.
The Angry Earth wouldn't have attacked the mines, if he hadn't agitated them. The Corrupted? Ask around and you'll find the truth about that.
Hmm…stay wary of dangers.
Hmm…stay alert and don't die.
The Pioneer's Lament
Help a doomed farmer move on with his life.
Help, oh god, please help me.
What's wrong?"
Forgive me, I’ve made a horrible, horrible mistake. I tried to start a farm in Edengrove. I moved my family here. We were to harvest paradise. Fool!
The Angry Earth didn’t take kindly to their new neighbors.
"What happened next?"
We were overrun. My entire family rendered Lost. All my fault. If I don’t get back to work I fear I will share the same fate.
But all my equipment is back at the farm, and I haven’t the mettle to return. Could you recover it?
Go to my farm, fight off the Angry Earth who have claimed it, and retrieve my farming equipment. And perhaps some token of my family. I am a broken, lonely man.
You found my equipment, thank god. But what’s this? A letter from my son? He says he’s raising a farm in Ebonscale Reach, the brave, resourceful lad.
“He survived the attack after all.”
All is not lost! I shall reunite with him straight away. Thank you for delivering this news, you have saved me from the brink.
Go to {POITags}
Search the farm for Abiathar's equipment
Heart Beats Hate
Harvest the heart of Aeternum's angriest Dryad Brute, for science.
Have a heart for science?
"How can I help?"
Ay, look at yon Dryad Brute. Just stares at that tower all day, seething. Fascinating. ‘Balor the Belligerent,’ I call him.
I’ve never seen a creature so consumed with hatred. How I’d love to peek into his heart.
"Why his heart?"
It would tell me a great deal about what makes the Angry Earth so damn angry. Think you could manage such an excision?
There’s a Dryad Brute called Balor the Belligerent. I need his heart. His beautiful, hate-filled heart. Kill him and bring it to me, if you would be so kind.
You have the heart, do you? Very resourceful. Look at that, pumping rage and venom. Once I distill it I’ll be capable of the same.
"Wait, I thought he was evil?"
Oh, yes. It’s for a rage potion of my own. Why else would I be wanting his heart, now?
I just need to figure how to brew it without blowing myself to bits in the process. Wish me luck.
Go to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and harvest his heart
Art is Suffering
Deface an avant-garde sculptress's embarrassing early work.
"Can I help you?"
Ahem. Like all great artists, I was in a state of deep meditation. Creativity means surrender, not control. It took me centuries to learn that.
“Evolving as an artist is natural.”
Truly. I’ve found my artistic calling, but it took centuries of chiseling out dross. Pity that marble is such a timeless medium.
I’d destroy my early work if I could, but my old work space is teeming with Angry Earth now.
"You should fight for your art."
I make art, not war. But you have the look of one who’s dealt their share of violence.
Might I trouble you to spare my reputation and thrash up some old sculptures? It could be rather fun for you.
Dispose of some poorly aged sculptures from my formative years.
All gone? Thank the Muses! Someday I shall memorialize your deeds in marble.
I’m in my “Contra-Formic, Manneristic-Deconstructivism” period, so expect to see an arbitrary number of limbs and a loose sense of shape.
Care to support the arts?
Go to {POITags}
Destroy the embarrassing sculpture
Destroy the sophomoric sculpture
Destroy the poorly aged sculpture
Destroy the amateurish sculpture
Destroy the mediocre sculpture
Isn't this place beautiful? Like the scents of the first rain of the season.
The colours here are so vivid, it reminds me of the time I had with my mum.
"Can you talk to the plants too?"
Yes, the plants are speaking, even though I can't understand their words. Maybe their emotions?
Haha. If we can talk to plants, can we talk to anything? And if we can talk to anything, are we ever alone?
"What did your mum want?"
My mum probably wanted me to feel how we're all connected.
Edengrove can feel a bit cold and distant. But here, with these talking plants? It's almost like we're friends. We are friends!
Wyldwood Water
Find the Wyldwood Water recipe for Antara.
Doesn't life seem endless sometimes? My mum and I used to sit on the tallest cliffs, our legs dangling over the edge, teasing death.
She was so adventurous. So indomitable. I miss her. And I don't know if I'll ever measure up to what she was.
"You can leave your own mark."
Hah. I only want to continue my mother's legacy. I want to find the potion she said would help us see the world as it really is.
Based on our research, the Dryads should have it here. Will you help me find it?
Did you find the recipe? It should be in one of the chests on this bridge.
Wonderful! I can’t believe it. You found the recipe for Wyldwood Water! I wish my mother was here to see this.
Go to Avernal Verdure
Get ingredients for Wyldwood Water
Get recipe for Wyldwood Water
Everywhere Friends
Understand the message Antara's mother wanted to convey through the Wyldwood Water.
Here's the Wyldwood Water. Doesn't it have a strange sheen, as if there's something living in its depths?
I don't know the exact effects of drinking it.
"I'm immortal. I like taking risks."
Hah, clever! Yes, we can't really die on this island. And you seem to have enough spirit to keep from turning Lost.
Ready, then? Let's have the Wyldwood Water and see what happens.
How are you feeling? Do you notice anything different about the nature around you?
I'm glad you're here with me. I guess the universe works in strange ways and I'm lucky you came to the bridge when you did.
Go to Nimue Weir
See the effects of Wyldwood Water
Hear Plant 1
Hear Plant 2
Hear Plant 3
I'll always remember you. I wish I'd met you before. I think my mum would have liked you.
(The colors rich, the strokes indulgent, a rendering of Edengrove that can only be described as abstract. Clearly, the artist was lost in his thoughts.)
(The colors rich, the strokes indulgent, a rendering of Edengrove that can only be described as abstract. Clearly, the artist was lost in his thoughts.)
What do you think of the art that surrounds us? Some would say the sight is almost breathtaking.
But when you're a true artist, you see every color, every shape without attaching any emotion to it. I miss being a plebian.
Incomparable Blue
Return the misplaced easel to Pietr Wolcott.
"Study painting."
(The painting has been signed by a P. Wolcott. Upon closer inspection, there's a note asking for it to be returned if found.)
(The painting has been signed by a P. Wolcott. Upon closer inspection, there's a note asking for it to be returned if found.)
Ah! That is my painting. You have passed my test to find a genuine appreciator of fine art.
My artistic endeavors require assistance. The kind only a fellow soul can undertake.
"Would we draw together?"
Maybe someday. When I have ascertained you've reached the desired artistic level. To start, could you bring me a blue to match the surreal cerulean of Edengrove?
What a gorgeous blue! It's so close to the shade I imagined.
Maybe you do have the makings of an artist, if you ever choose to drop the sword and pick up a brush instead, which seems unlikely.
You have done well, friend. Thank you for finding me this most glorious blue.
I hope I can count on you if I need to collaborate for any future creative pursuits. Till then, toodaloo!
Go to Sylphid Gleam
Find Pietr Wolcott
Collect dyes from striped boars
Talk To Pietr Wolcott
